opendial.domains.rules

Class Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.domains.rules.Rule

  • public class Rule
extends java.lang.Object
    Generic representation of a probabilistic rule, with an identifier and an ordered list of cases. The rule can be either a probability or a utility rule.
    Version:
    $Date:: 2014-03-20 21:16:08 #$
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Rule.RuleType 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Rule(java.lang.String id, Rule.RuleType ruleType)
      Creates a new rule, with the given identifier and type, and an empty list of cases

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCase(RuleCase newCase)
      Adds a new case to the abstract rule
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
      Returns true if o is a rule that has the same identifier, rule type and list of cases than the current rule.
      java.util.Set<Assignment> getGroundings(Assignment input)
      Returns the set of groundings that can be derived from the rule and the specific input assignment.
      java.util.Set<Template> getInputVariables()
      Returns the input variables (possibly underspecified, with slots to fill) for the rule
      RuleOutput getOutput(Assignment input)
      Returns the first case whose condition matches the input assignment provided as argument.
      java.util.Set<Template> getOutputVariables()
      Returns the set of all (templated) output variables defined inside the rule
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getParameterIds()
      Returns the set of all parameter identifiers employed in the rule
      java.lang.String getRuleId()
      Returns the rule identifier
      Rule.RuleType getRuleType()
      Returns the rule type
      int hashCode()
      Returns the hashcode for the rule
      boolean hasUnderspecifiedEffects()
      Returns true if at least one effect is underspecified (with a variable reference or free variable).

      Returns a string representation for the rule

      • getOutput

        public RuleOutput getOutput(Assignment input)
        Returns the first case whose condition matches the input assignment provided as argument. The case contains the grounded list of effects associated with the satisfied condition.
        Parameters:
        input - the input assignment
        Returns:
        the matched rule case.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the possible groundings for the rule

      • hasUnderspecifiedEffects

        public boolean hasUnderspecifiedEffects()
        Returns true if at least one effect is underspecified (with a variable reference or free variable).
        Returns:
        true if at least one effect is underspecified, and false otherwise

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Returns true if o is a rule that has the same identifier, rule type and list of cases than the current rule.
